Detailed Description

AG - A class for logging and messages generated throughout the application. Use globals sparingly.

Usage:
At file scope, declare exactly one instance of this class and one instance of a stdout text stream:
  • AG gGbl;
  • QTextStream gStdout(stdout, QIODevice::ReadWrite);
Error Handling:
On an error, a method log an error to mMsgs including the class, method, the current arguments, and the reason. It then returns an error code that is passed back to calling routine. The calling routine is responsible for cleaning up and then returning an error code back up the chain. This way, the call that knows the most about the error can log the error. The alternative would be to use a signal to send the error to a logging facility.
Compare this approach with that of QT where a global qDebug function is called from any class method to report errors using printf instead of a text stream.

Every class can log messages and errors in any one of several ways:

  1. Stream messages to mMsgs: gGbl.mMsgs << gGbl.mpErr[AG::meFileOpen] << endl;
  2. Append messages to mMsg: gGbl.mMsg += gGbl.mpErr[AG::meFileOpen] + "\n"
  3. Stream messages directly to mStdout: gStdout << gGbl.mpErr[AG::meFileOpen] << endl The first option is preferable. At the end of the program the messages in gGbl.mMsg can be diverted to stdout using:

gStdout << gSr.mMsg << endl
